## Unified Risk‑Management & Compliance Framework  
**Purpose:**  Provide the Audit Committee with a single, auditable view of how the firm protects the **DT‑A (Deferred Tax Asset) preservation**, **DPT (Domestic‑Pension‑Trust) defence**, and **GAAR (General Anti‑Abuse Rule) exposure**.  

The framework is built on the **COSO Enterprise‑Risk‑Management** model (Control Environment → Risk Assessment → Control Activities → Information & Communication → Monitoring).  
For each major control point we list:

| # | Control Point (What we do) | Risk Addressed | Key Performance Indicator (KPI) | Target / Tolerance | Measurement Method | Reporting Cadence to Audit Committee | Owner |
|---|----------------------------|----------------|--------------------------------|--------------------|--------------------|--------------------------------------|-------|
| **1** | **DT‑A Preservation Policy** – Formal policy that defines when a DT‑A can be written‑off, the “more‑than‑50 %” test, and the documentation required for each jurisdiction. | Premature DT‑A write‑off → tax‑benefit loss; non‑compliance with ASC 740/IAS 12. | **% of DT‑A balances reviewed against the 50 % test** (count of DT‑A balances that have a documented “more‑than‑50 %” assessment ÷ total DT‑A balances). | ≥ 95 % reviewed each FY. | Automated extraction from the tax‑accounting system; cross‑checked with the “DT‑A Review Log”. | **Quarterly** – KPI slide in Q‑board pack; **Annual** deep‑dive with supporting work‑papers. | Tax‑Accounting Lead |
| **2** | **DT‑A Documentation Repository** – Centralised, version‑controlled repository (SharePoint/OneDrive) for all DT‑A supporting calculations, assumptions, and board approvals. | Missing or outdated documentation → audit findings, GAAR challenge. | **Document completeness score** = (Number of DT‑A files with all required artefacts – missing items) ÷ total DT‑A files. | ≥ 98 % completeness. | Quarterly audit of repository metadata + random sample verification. | **Quarterly** – Repository health dashboard; **Ad‑hoc** when a write‑off is proposed. | Tax Ops Manager |
| **3** | **DPT Defence Checklist** – Pre‑transaction checklist that confirms the DPT meets the “substance‑over‑form” test, the “no‑tax‑avoidance” test, and the “public‑policy” test. | GAAR exposure on DPT structures; reputational risk. | **Checklist pass‑rate** = (Number of DPT transactions that cleared all checklist items ÷ total DPT transactions). | 100 % (no exception tolerated). | Automated workflow (e.g., ServiceNow) that forces “sign‑off” before transaction booking. | **Monthly** – Summary of new DPT transactions + any exceptions; **Quarterly** – Trend analysis. | DPT Governance Lead |
| **4** | **GAAR Exposure Register** – Central register of all transactions that have a GAAR risk rating (Low/Medium/High). | Undetected GAAR‑triggering arrangements → tax adjustments, penalties. | **% of High‑Risk items with mitigation plan approved** = (High‑risk items with documented mitigation ÷ total High‑risk items). | ≥ 90 % within 30 days of identification. | Risk‑engine scoring (rules‑based) + manual review; status tracked in the register. | **Monthly** – Register snapshot; **Quarterly** – Heat‑map of risk exposure and mitigation status. | GAAR Risk Officer |
| **5** | **Tax‑Law Change Impact Assessment** – Formal process to capture legislative changes (e.g., OECD‑BEPS, local anti‑avoidance rules) and assess impact on DT‑A, DPT, GAAR. | Out‑of‑date controls → non‑compliance. | **Average days to close impact assessment** (Date of law change publication → date assessment signed off). | ≤ 30 days for major changes; ≤ 60 days for minor changes. | Calendar tracking in the Tax‑Change Management tool. | **Monthly** – “Change‑log” KPI; **Quarterly** – Summary of material changes and actions taken. | Tax Policy Lead |
| **6** | **Training & Competency Matrix** – Annual mandatory training on DT‑A, DPT, GAAR for tax, finance, legal, and business‑unit staff. | Knowledge gaps → control breakdown. | **Training completion rate** = (Number of required staff who completed training ÷ total required staff). | ≥ 100 % by 31 Mar each FY. | LMS reporting; certification stored in HRIS. | **Quarterly** – Completion % per function; **Annual** – Certification audit. | Learning & Development (L&D) Partner |
| **7** | **Independent Tax‑Compliance Review** – External or internal audit of the entire DT‑A/DPT/GAAR control set‑up. | Assurance gap; audit‑committee confidence. | **Number of audit findings** (severity‑weighted). | Zero “high‑severity” findings; ≤ 2 “moderate” findings per year. | Annual external tax‑audit; internal control self‑assessment. | **Annually** – Full audit‑report package; **Quarterly** – Management response status. | Internal Audit Lead |
| **8** | **Exception Management & Escalation** – Formal log for any deviation from policy (e.g., DT‑A write‑off without 50 % test, DPT checklist bypass). | Uncontrolled exceptions → hidden risk. | **Mean Time to Resolve (MTTR) exceptions** = Σ (Resolution date – Log date) ÷ number of exceptions. | ≤ 15 days for “medium” and ≤ 5 days for “high” severity. | Exception‑tracking system (e.g., JIRA). | **Monthly** – Exception dashboard; **Quarterly** – Trend & root‑cause analysis. | Compliance Officer |
| **9** | **Data‑Integrity Controls** – Validation of tax‑accounting data feeds (e.g., ERP → tax‑module) to ensure no “ghost” DT‑A or DPT entries. | Incorrect data → false KPI reporting. | **Data‑reconciliation error rate** = (Number of mismatched records ÷ total records processed). | ≤ 0.1 % per month. | Automated reconciliation scripts; exception alerts. | **Monthly** – Reconciliation summary; **Quarterly** – Exception drill‑down. | Finance Systems Owner |
| **10** | **Board‑Level Reporting Package** – Consolidated “Tax‑Risk Dashboard” that rolls up the above KPIs, risk‑heat maps, and exception trends. | Lack of visibility for the Audit Committee. | **Dashboard completeness score** = (All required KPI widgets present & up‑to‑date ÷ total required widgets). | 100 % for each reporting cycle. | Dashboard built in Power BI/Tableau; automated data refresh. | **Quarterly** – Formal presentation at Audit Committee meeting; **Ad‑hoc** – When a high‑severity GAAR event occurs. | CFO Office (Risk Reporting Lead) |

---

### How the Framework Works in Practice  

1. **Risk Identification (COSO – Risk Assessment)**  
   * The **GAAR Exposure Register** and **Tax‑Law Change Impact Assessment** continuously surface new risks.  
   * Each risk is classified (Low/Medium/High) and assigned an owner.

2. **Control Design (COSO – Control Activities)**  
   * For every identified risk we have a **control point** (policy, checklist, repository, training, etc.).  
   * Controls are **documented** in the **Control‑Activity Register** and linked to the relevant KPI.

3. **Information & Communication (COSO – Information & Communication)**  
   * KPI data flow: source system → KPI engine → Power BI dashboard → Audit‑Committee package.  
   * **Exception Management** forces immediate notification to the CFO and the Audit Committee when a control fails.

4. **Monitoring (COSO – Monitoring Activities)**  
   * **Monthly** operational reports (KPIs, exception logs, data‑integrity) are reviewed by the **Risk‑Management Office**.  
   * **Quarterly** board‑level package is signed off by the CFO, the Tax‑Policy Lead, and Internal Audit before distribution.  
   * **Annual** external tax‑audit validates the entire control environment.

5. **Feedback & Continuous Improvement**  
   * After each Audit‑Committee meeting, a **Control‑Improvement Action Log** captures any agreed enhancements (e.g., tightening the DT‑A review frequency).  
   * The **MTTR for exceptions** KPI drives process‑improvement cycles.

| Avg days to close tax‑law impact assessment | 22 days | ≤ 30 days | ↔︎ | Recent BEPS update closed in 18 days. |

| Data‑reconciliation error rate | 0.04 % | ≤ 0.1 % | – | Within tolerance. |

*The dashboard is refreshed automatically on the **first business day of each month**; the **quarterly slide deck** is exported and signed off by the CFO before the Audit Committee meeting.*

## Reporting Cadence Summary  

| Cadence | Deliverable | Audience | Key Content |
|---------|-------------|----------|-------------|
| **Monthly** | **Operational KPI & Exception Report** | CFO, Tax‑Ops, Risk‑Management | KPI tables, exception log, data‑integrity errors, GAAR register snapshot. |
| **Quarterly** | **Audit‑Committee Tax‑Risk Package** | Audit Committee, Board | Consolidated dashboard, trend analysis, high‑risk items, remediation status, training completion. |
| **Semi‑Annual** | **Control‑Effectiveness Review** | Internal Audit, CFO | Results of internal control self‑assessment, audit‑findings, MTTR trends. |
| **Annual** | **External Tax‑Compliance Audit Report** | Audit Committee, Board, Regulators | Full audit opinion, GAAR exposure assessment, DT‑A preservation audit, DPT defence validation. |
| **Ad‑hoc** | **Incident / High‑Severity GAAR Alert** | CFO, Audit Committee (within 48 h) | Description of event, immediate impact, mitigation steps, expected reporting update. |

| Build Power BI “Tax‑Risk Dashboard” (data pipelines, KPI calculations) | Risk‑Reporting Lead | 31 May 2026 | Dashboard passes UAT; auto‑refresh enabled. |

| Perform pilot “DT‑A Review” cycle (Q3 2026) | Tax‑Accounting Lead | 30 Sep 2026 | ≥ 95 % DT‑A balances reviewed; KPI captured. |
| Quarterly Board‑level reporting (Q3 2026) | CFO Office | 15 Oct 2026 | Dashboard package delivered, sign‑off obtained. |
| External tax‑compliance audit (FY 2026) | Internal Audit Lead | 31 Mar 2027 | Audit opinion issued, no high‑severity findings. |

---

### Bottom Line for the Audit Committee  

* **Visibility:** Every material risk (DT‑A erosion, DPT defence breach, GAAR exposure) is quantified with a KPI that is refreshed **at least monthly**.  
* **Accountability:** Clear owners, escalation paths, and **MTTR targets** ensure that any control failure is corrected quickly.  
* **Assurance:** Independent **annual tax‑audit** plus **quarterly internal reviews** give the Committee a continuous assurance loop.  
* **Decision‑Ready Data:** The **Power BI dashboard** presents a single‑page, colour‑coded view of compliance health, enabling the Committee to focus on exceptions rather than raw data.  

By adopting the tabled control points, KPIs, and reporting cadence, the organization will meet the **DT‑A preservation requirements**, maintain a **robust DPT defence**, and keep **GAAR exposure** within an acceptable, monitored range—delivering the legal and tax integrity the Audit Committee expects.
